title: The Papers: 'No heat to eat' as 'Sunak told: slash more taxes'
description: Thursday's front pages respond to Chancellor Rishi Sunak's Spring Statement.

title: A Kremlin adviser resigns and Ukrainian territory regained - Ukraine's latest war round-up
description: Ukrainian forces are pushing back Russia's advances to Kyiv's west, as a Kremlin adviser resigns.

title: Ukraine war: Russian journalist Oksana Baulina killed in Kyiv shelling
description: Oksana Baulina died while filming destruction caused by Russian shelling in a Kyiv neighbourhood.

title: Life of Madeleine Albright, the Czech-born US political trailblazer
description: Originally born in Czechoslovakia, Albright became a trailblazer for women on the world stage.

title: World Cup 'hurt' driving Wales for play-offs, says Bale
description: Wales will use the "hurt" of previous near misses as inspiration for Thursday's World Cup play-off semi-final against Austria, says captain Gareth Bale.

title: Spring Statement: Key points at a glance
description: The chancellor laid out his Spring Statement amid a cost of living squeeze. Here's what you should know.

title: People face biggest drop in living standards since 1956
description: Wages will lag soaring prices meaning the biggest drop in standards since 1956, says the OBR.

title: Spring Statement: One family's cost of living experience
description: The Fords are a busy family and, like many, they’ve noticed the impact of rising prices.

title: Taliban schools U-turn 'a devastating day' for Afghan girls - Malala Yousafzai
description: The Taliban’s U-turn on girls' high schools is heartbreaking, the Nobel Peace Prize laureate says.

title: How Rishi Sunak's Spring Statement will affect you
description: Surging prices, National Insurance changes and fuel duty cuts - the impact on your finances explained.

title: Plans for giant, lit-up dome approved for Olympics site
description: The controversial sphere will be covered in lights and become one of London's biggest music venues.

title: BBC editors react to Sunak's 2022 Spring Statement
description: Laura Kuenssberg, Faisal Islam and Simon Jack review the headlines and reaction to the chancellor's update on the UK economy.

title: David Amess killing: Suspect looked 'self-satisfied' after attack
description: A murder trial was told a piercing scream was heard minutes after Ali Harbi Ali met Sir David Amess.

title: Pressure on Sunak as inflation hits new 30-year high
description: Inflation hit 6.2% in February, laying bare the challenge the chancellor faces in his Spring Statement.

title: PM: 'It looks like P&O mass sackings broke the law'
description: Boris Johnson says P&O Ferries could face fines of "millions" after sacking 800 staff suddenly.

title: Olympic Park: Major gas leak incident at London Aquatics Centre
description: A number of people are being treated for breathing difficulties at the Olympic Park in Stratford.

title: Are the P&O Ferries sackings legal?
description: P&O has been widely criticised for sacking 800 employees - but are its actions illegal?

title: Angel Lynn: Kidnapped woman's abusive ex has sentence increased
description: Angel Lynn was left with life-changing injuries after being kidnapped by her then boyfriend.

title: Erik ten Hag: Manchester United speak to Ajax coach about manager's job
description: Manchester United speak to Ajax's highly rated coach Erik ten Hag about their vacant manager's job.

title: Child Q: Hackney mayor calls for school's head teacher to resign
description: Hackney's mayor says he has no confidence in the school leadership after a black pupil was strip-searched.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban backtrack on reopening high schools for girls
description: Girls' high schools were ordered shut hours after they re-opened, sparking anger and frustration.

title: Beer throwing at Phoenix Open 'unacceptable' and will be 'addressed' - PGA Tour chief
description: The throwing of beer and water bottles at the Phoenix Open will be "addressed", says PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan.

title: MVP title bout off as Ukrainian champion joins fight against Russia
description: Ukrainian welterweight champion Yaroslav Amosov joins fight against Russia - meaning his bout against Britain's Michael 'Venom' Page is off.

title: UK and Ireland FAs submit expression of interest on Euro 2028 bid
description: The UK and Republic of Ireland football associations submit a joint expression of interest in staging the European Championships in 2028.

title: George Montague: Tributes to 'oldest gay' campaigner after death at 98
description: Pride director Paul Kemp said George Montague was "a lovely spirit" who "died a happy man".

title: Ashleigh Barty: World number one makes shock call to quit tennis
description: Australian player Ashleigh Barty - aged only 25 - says she will retire to "chase other dreams".

title: Deplorable scam emails fake fundraising for Ukraine
description: Action Fraud warns of fake emails asking for donations to victims of the war.

title: War in Ukraine: 'Pets are getting left at train stations'
description: A photographer from the UK travels to western Ukraine to rescue pets displaced by war.

title: Oscars 2022: 18 bitesize facts about this year's nominees
description: A round-up of quirky facts and possible record breakers ahead of Sunday's Academy Awards.

title: China plane crash: Search teams find flight's black box
description: Crews had struggled against rain and flooded terrain to find key clues to the plane’s sudden fall.

title: P&O says it did not break law as £100k payouts revealed
description: The firm says it didn't break law over sackings as it shares details of £36.5m compensation plan.

title: 'We feel like we are building' - England captain Knight has eyes on World Cup semi-final
description: England will have no room for complacency when they meet Pakistan in the Women's World Cup, says captain Heather Knight.

title: Qatar World Cup: Eleven European nations battle for one of three places in finals
description: Eleven European nations are chasing the continent's final three Qatar 2022 World Cup places - and some big names are set to miss out.

title: 'I was shocked to find out I now have four kidneys'
description: Transplant patient Stuart Middleton has both his kidneys - along with two he received from donors.

title: Is Rishi Sunak a tax-cutter?
description: The chancellor says he wants to cut taxes - but figures show how taxes have risen under his watch.

title: Leicestershire boy with cerebral palsy learns to walk
description: Five-year-old Joey is taking steps after a life-changing operation and months of physiotherapy.

title: A month in Ukraine: 'All normal life is gone'
description: The BBC's Sarah Rainsford travelled around Ukraine as the war started and lives were shattered.

title: Laptop art: From Vans to Harry Styles
description: Photography student Thorsten Mjölnir captures the way students decorate their laptops.

title: Lockdown: How residents of London's Corona Road coped
description: Residents in one aptly named London street reflect on how their lives have changed over two years.

title: The Russians trapped on a Thai island as war rages in Ukraine
description: Thousands of Russian and Ukrainian tourists are stuck in Phuket, unable to go home.

title: Teamsters: A sleeping American giant now spoiling for a fight
description: Teamsters were once known for Jimmy Hoffa and ties to the mob. Their new boss wants to take on Amazon.

title: CEO Secrets: 'Don't be trapped by your job title'
description: Roberta Lucca, co-founder of video games company Bossa Studios, shares her business advice for our CEO Secrets series.
